pageContext.claim: “And I think a big factor is the mortality rate. We're talking about the mortality rate. You know, when we first started, people were thinking about 3 and 4 percent, and now we're talking about a much lower number than that. I think it's a -- I think it's a number that will be a lot different than people thought...you don't know how many there are. It could be a vast number. But what you do know is all the people that are really sick. Because all of the people that are really sick are going to a doctor in some form, and the doctor is reporting it in all cases. So I think the number is much lower than we think.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump often speculated about the mortality rate from covid-19 based on incomplete information, apparently as a way of minimizing the problem. But the actual death rate won't be able to be calculated for some time, probably years. It's unclear how many people actually became infected.
